pr_title: HDDS-4315. Use Epoch to generate unique ObjectIDs

timeline.bodyText: I am thinking for this extreme case, user cannot write object anymore when TransactionID exceeds MAX_TRXN_ID, right? So what can we do for this, have to setup a new Ozone cluster to use?
timeline.author: linyiqun

timeline.message: HDDS-4315. Ensure ObjectIDs are unique across restarts
HDDS-4315. Ensure ObjectIDs are unique across restarts

timeline.author: linyiqun

timeline.bodyText: I prefer to reuse metadataManager#getOmEpoch to set epoch value, so that epoch number is from one same place.
timeline.author: linyiqun

timeline.bodyText: can we use  1 << 54  instead of Math.pow ?
timeline.author: prashantpogde

timeline.bodyText: Don't we want these values to be 0 and 1 instead of 1 & 2 ?
timeline.author: prashantpogde

replies.bodyText: Wanted to avoid 0 as we can assume that currently it is 0. This would give us a way to separate out objectIds created before this fix. If ever, these non-unique objectIds need to be fixed, it would be easy to identify them.
replies.author: hanishakoneru
